poem:
Title: "The Party's Crossroads"

Labour spins on its battleground,
A left-turn skewered on a question mark.
Turning faces to stubborn stars,
Millions cry in pillow-fluffed dark.
Equality demands heart wins,
Mind revolutions– no overnight lark.
Change is a slow-dancing stranger,
Take caution, it's no walk in the park.
